Text.Value: A clown's arm, stained with greasepaint and blood.
Dribbles' arm, judging from the smeared greasepaint.
One of Dribbles' limbs. I always knew clowns were 'armless.
A clown's arm. It's thrown its last custard pie, by the look of it.
Dribbles' arm, it must be. Unless there's been a rash of clown murders I'm not aware of.
Clown's arm. Blech.
More clown. An arm, this time - just lovely.
The arm of a clown. Some madman has a sense of whimsy.
Alas poor Dribbles. His juggling days are behind him.
Pale and painted skin - the clown's arm. NO, BOO - not for nibbling!
A clown's arm - Dribbles', no doubt.

EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Picked up the arm from a Tableaux.

Text.Value: Dribbles' foot - and it smells even worse than it looks.
The clown's foot, I wager. I wonder if it was odorous when he was alive as it is now.
Dribbles' foot.  His oversized shoes did little to prevent it sweating - that's quite the stench.
The foot of a clown. Someone's sending a message - just don't ask me what, exactly.
A dismembered foot - Dribbles', most certainly.
The clown's foot. Well, all right.
Clown-foot. Someone wanted it found.
A clown's foot, displayed like a butcher's offering.
The clown's foot. It smells like tenday-old roth√© cheese.
Dribbles' foot. Perhaps we might still find him, limping around...?
A foot, smeared with paint... among other things. This must belong to Dribbles.

EditorData.NodeContext: smells like rotten flesh, eye-wateringly so
EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Picked up the foot from a Tableaux.

Text.Value: A good start, but the ringmaster wants more. We need the whole clown.
Ugh. Well, that's a start, but we need the whole clown before we return to the Ringmaster.
That's not all of him, though. The hunt continues.
We're not done just yet. There's still more clown scraps out there.
We'll need to track down the rest before we see the ringmaster.
We're still missing a few pieces. Better look around before it starts stinking.
A grim souvenir. The ringmaster will want more, I suspect.
There must be more pieces to this corpse-puzzle, yet to be found.
Boo thinks the ringmaster is looking for a little more than this.
This is a most entertaining game. I wonder what we will find next?
That can't be all of Dribbles. Come on - let's find the rest.

EditorData.logicalname: Found a piece, need to find more

Text.Value: We nearly have an entire clown - just one piece left. I hope.
Not quite the full clown. One piece missing, by my count.
Just one bit of Dribbles left to find, and we'll own the entire collection.
Almost done - just one piece left.
One more chunk of Dribbles left to go...
That's got to be nearly all of him, right?
Not much of poor Dribbles left to gather, I'd wager.
Just one piece of clown cadaver yet to be found.
Another clown portion. Is that motley, or...? Ugh. Come, Boo - there is more to find!
We have so many clown parts, my pack is sodden with them. But we are still missing a piece.
There can't be much of him left to find. Come on.
I wonder if the rest of the clown is as... artfully presented.
A gaudy display - his killer has a flair for the dramatic. I doubt this is their only masterpiece.
Plenty more to find. Shouldn't be difficult - the killer seems quite proud of their accomplishment.
A gruesome display. I wonder if Dribbles' act was as artful as his death...
Better search around for his other parts.
Guess if we find a few more of these little scenes, we'll have gathered the rest of him.
Pieces of the clown, put on display. Not my favourite kind of puzzle.
We ought to seek out other such displays - they may yield more clown parts.
That is most, but not all, of the Dribbles. Unless he was an especially tiny clown.
Let us find the rest of him. I was a childhood champion of jivvin-qu'uente, a game much like this one.
The question is - where is the rest of him?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: "We need to look more for the similar Tableauxes"
EditorData.logicalname: First piece which was found on a Tableaux

Text.Value: A clown's head. Not laughing now, are you, Dribbles?
Dribbles' head, cut clean off. Someone saved their sharpest blade for the occasion.
Dribbles' head, severed at the neck. No covering that up with face-paint.
A head, parted from its neck. Dribbles, I believe.
The clown's head. Sorry, Dribbles.
Oh gods. That's got to be Dribbles' head.
Dribbles' mangled clown head. Long life or no, this might well be the worst thing I have ever seen.
A head, parted from the trunk. The true Dribbles, I assume.
Ha. The clown's head. Finally a joke worth savouring.
A tragedy, Boo! The great Dribbles will dribble no more. Well... a little more.
Wait, I know this head. It belongs to Dribbles the clown!

EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Picked the head from a Tableaux.

Text.Value: That's it - one whole clown. Now can we please give him to the ringmaster?
That's every piece of him. Time to take this sorry jigsaw to the ringmaster.
That's it, then. Back to the Ringmaster.
That must be all of him. We should chat with the Ringmaster.
That's the last piece of clown. Better see the ringmaster.
That's the last of it. Better show Lucretious.
All right, enough offal - this ought to satisfy the ringmaster.
The final bodypart. Time to show the Ringmaster.
There! The clown is whole once more - with a little bit of stitching from the ringmaster, perhaps.
We have every part of that rancid clown. We should return him to the ringmaster, though I prefer him disassembled.
I think that's it - we've found all of him. Time to show the Ringmaster.
A bloody leg. From a bloody awful clown, no doubt.
A leg, liberally 'dribbled' with blood. No surprise which clown this belonged to.
Dribbles' leg, still bearing scraps of tattered fabric. Once bright and jovial, now bloody and joyless.
This must be part of Dribbles, judging from the cloth.
A leg clad in colourful scraps. Oh, Dribbles...
Look at those colours. That's a clown's leg for sure.
This was the clown's leg, I think.
The leg of Dribbles, the clown. How many pieces was he split into?
No more jigs and cavorting for Dribbles.
Ugh. To be carved up and staked out like some festival haunch... Dribbles deserved better, Boo!
Judging by the state of the leg, this must be part of the clown.

EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Picked up the leg from a Tableaux.

Text.Value: A clown's dismembered torso, still in jolly rags.
A whole torso, clad in bloodied clown garb. Dribbles', of course.
A clown's bloody torso. No more belly laughs for Dribbles.
A piece of clown, going by the colour. Dribbles, I presume.
Damn - a whole chunk of torso. Someone really had it out for that clown.
Clown's torso. Gods, it's awful.
Dribbles' torso - limbs a-trimmed.
The torso of a clown, parted from head and limbs. Dribbles, no doubt.
Such a delightfully garish costume. Such a delightfully dismembered clown.
This was the clown's cheery trunk I think, Boo.
A colourful torso, torn and butchered. Hello, Dribbles.

EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Picked up the torso from a Tableaux.

Text.Value: Is that a pelvis? Gods, you almost feel sorry for Dribbles.
A lone pelvis and a bit of colourful cloth. Dribbles met a brutal end.
Gods, even Dribbles' pelvis was severed. His jokes can't have been that bad...
Looks like a clown's pelvis. Not a sentence I ever thought I'd have to utter, but here we are...
Is that... a pelvis? Oh, poor Dribbles.
Another bit of clown. Please, no more.
More of the clown. A grim manner of motley, this.
This pelvis sports colourful motley - from a dismembered clown.
A hefty chunk of clown-meat. This really is most amusing.
Painted cloth on painted flesh...? Ah. No. This is a cut of clown-loin, Boo.
Circus clothes? What an end for Dribbles the clown.

EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Picked up the pelvis from a Tableaux.

Text.Value: A painted hand. It belongs to Dribbles or someone with equally woeful taste.
Ah - a stray hand. Dribbles', of course - it's smeared with paint and blood.
White  paint and blood on the finger tips? This must be Dribbles' hand.
Greasepaint. This is Dribbles' hand, no doubt.
A piece of Dribbles - the hand, I think.
Now that's a clown-y hand. Found part of Dribbles, then.
Sticky, painted skin. This hand belonged to the clown, no question.
Daubed in greasepaint. A clown's appendage, no doubt.
The hand smells of greasepaint and spun sugar. It belonged to the clown, no doubt.
The nails all painted like the rainbow. If the rainbow were red and sticky - rest in peace, Dribbles.
Bloody, painted fingertips. This hand belonged to Dribbles, no question.

EditorData.logicalname: On the quest. Got hand from the kobold

Text.Value: A clown's decapitated head? Is this modern art or just murder?
So - the dismembered head of a clown. Not what I'd guessed.
A clown's severed head? I'm no expert on circuses, but I can't imagine them getting a lot of laughs out of that...
The head of a clown? Unorthodox choice of decoration, I'll admit.
A head of a clown. Just what sort of circus is this?
A clown's head?! Now that's fucked up.
Ugh - a severed head, daubed in face-paint. Someone took exception to this clown's act.
The head of a clown? I have little use for this.
The severed head of a clown - a splendid gift, and it's not even my birthday.
A jester's head. This... is not a trick I have seen before, Boo.
This is the head... of a clown. Right.

EditorData.logicalname: Not on the quest. Found head on a Tableaux

Text.Value: Is that - yes, flesh. Human flesh, no less.
Let's see what - oh! A heart, a liver, a few fingers. Not the most appetising find.
Entrails on display? This circus doesn't think much of its customers, does it?
Body parts on display? Not sure the children will care for that.
Not sure what I expected to find. But organs and entrails were not in my top twenty.
Blech. Are these... entrails?!
Humanoid body parts - butchered and put up on display.
Body parts, put on display? A vile showing.
Human flesh, mutilated and placed on display. Somebody's been enjoying themselves.
Offal in some manner of... display?
Body parts? Is this some kind of... display?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Please don't mention a specific body part, it can by any but not a hand or head.
EditorData.logicalname: Not on the quest. Found any peace but hand or head on a Tableaux.

Synopsis: An automated dialog that will be called each time the party picks up a piece of Dribbles. They comment on what they find and also how much they have left to gather.
